DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality Attention Problems Scale T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Attention Problems Scale in the Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality Attention Problems Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings._A clinical assessment tool that uses targeted forms for monitoring changes in behavior or emotional status. It provides insight into a child's or adult's thoughts and feelings._A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children that measures the tendency of the subject to be distracted and unable to concentrate._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.:A clinical assessment tool that uses targeted forms for monitoring changes in behavior or emotional status. It provides insight into a child's or adult's thoughts and feelings.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Assessment System for Children, Second Edition
Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.
A clinical assessment tool that uses targeted forms for monitoring changes in behavior or emotional status. It provides insight into a child's or adult's thoughts and feelings.

Property.preferredDefinition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children that measures the tendency of the subject to be distracted and unable to concentrate.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children that measures the tendency of the subject to be distracted and unable to concentrate.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Versioned to remove edition reference. mc 4/28/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
